column28:
next gen common connection profile includes many certs, this creates some rather big problems:

1. embed many certs in a json file makes json file not readable which is against common usage of json file which is to make the file human readable.
2. certs are required to be altered (insert new line escape) to satisfy json validation, doing this is painful and error prone.

I would suggest to do the following:

1. Use a compressed file instead of a single json file as a connection profile
2. The json file should be at the root of the package
3. The json file use url to locate various certificates
4. Url can be remote or local, if it is local, then the cert should be inside of the package relative to the json file, if it is remote, then cert get retrieved over https or http.

column1: The composer network start command doesn't run
column28:
I have seen several versions of this command to deploy a network and a business card. This one seems to be the most up to date however the network name is not recognized.

1. I run the install command: 

composer network install -a dist/iot-perishable-network.bna -c PeerAdmin@

2. I try to run the start command --> unsuccessfully

composer network start –-networkName iot-perishable-network -V 0.1.12 -c PeerAdmin@hlfv1 -A admin –S adminpw –a dist/iot-perishable-network.bna –f networkadmin.card

 ERROR: Missing required argument: networkName

I Have specified the network name, but it seems like it does not recognize it. Is it me doing something wrong or some problems with installed version, flags, environment set-up?

 

Thank you
column85:
05/Jul/18 12:03 AM;Soriano_LI;Need to have first a admin card. You can create with the script ./createPeeradmincard.

Next:

1.

composer network install --card PeerAdmin@hlfv1 --archiveFile <name>@0.0.1.bna

2.
 composer network start --networkName networkname --networkAdmin admin --networkAdminEnrollSecret adminpw --card PeerAdmin@hlfv1 --file networkadmin.card --networkVersion 0.0.1

 

"networkname" is the name you created before;;;
